definition: the sky spins, the earth goes round (idiom); giddy with one's head spinning/fig. huge changes in the world
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct
to revolve/to turn/to circle about/to walk about/classifier for revolutions (per minute etc): revs, rpm/classifier for repeated actions
to turn/to change direction/to transfer/to forward (mail)

sentences.english: The world has stopped spinning since the day you left.
sentences.chinese: 自從你離開後，我的世界就開始天旋地轉。

sentences.english: I felt faint and dizzy as if the sky and earth began to reel.
sentences.chinese: 我覺得昏昏沉沉，好像天旋地轉。

sentences.english: Suddenly, dizzy, flying sand and rolling pebbles, rampage.
sentences.chinese: 剎那間，天旋地轉，飛沙走石，橫衝直撞。

sentences.english: Your heart is racing, your head spinning, your hands tingling.
sentences.chinese: 你的心跳加速，天旋地轉，手臂發麻。

sentences.english: The world hasn't stopped spinningsince the day you left.
sentences.chinese: 自從你離開後，我的世界就開始天旋地轉。

sentences.english: My head is spinning, so I must lie down.
sentences.chinese: 我腦袋天旋地轉，得躺下來休息休息。

sentences.english: Just thinking about Megan brings a lump to his throat and makes his head spin.
sentences.chinese: 只要一想起梅根，他就喉嚨哽咽，天旋地轉。

definition: lit. crow and peacock make no sound/absolute silence (idiom); not a single voice can be heard/absolute silence
no way out/nowhere to go/trapped beyond hope of rescue/painted into a corner
variant of 戰慄|战栗[zhan4 li4]
lit. the soul flies away and scatters (idiom)/fig. to be frightened stiff/spooked out of one's mind/terror-stricken
to fly up/to dance in the air (of snowflakes, flower petals etc)
